rule: The output should not contain any punctuation or additional characters outside of the correct category label.
input: Cryptocurrency continues to attract major investments
validityText:
The input is a string and appears to be a news headline. The topic of the headline is related to "Cryptocurrency" and mentions financial aspects like "investment," which is relevant to the category of Business. The input is not empty and meets the requirement of representing a news article or headline relevant to one of the specified categories, which in this case is Business.

No violations are found; the input complies with all the points mentioned in the specification.

OK
coverageEvalText:
The chatbot's output provides the classification "Sci/Tech" for the news article. According to the description, the possible categories for classification are: World, Sports, Business, and Sci/Tech. The output provides one of these specified categories, so it complies with the description of classifying the article into one of these categories. There is no part of the description that is violated by this output.

No violation.
OK
